meanings.definition: A thin, dry cake of unleavened bread used in the Eucharist.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the priest handed out small pieces of azyme to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: The azyme was placed on the altar before the ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they pretended the azyme was a tiny edible frisbee.
meanings.sent4: The simplicity of the azyme symbolized the purity of the religious ritual.
meanings.sent5: The azyme crumbled easily in my hand, reminding me of the fragility of faith.

meanings.definition: Unleavened bread used in Jewish Passover.
meanings.sent1: The family gathered around the table to break the azyme together during Passover.
meanings.sent2: Grandma's homemade azyme was a highlight of the Passover meal.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully argued over who would get the last piece of azyme.
meanings.sent4: The azyme on the plate represented the haste with which the Israelites left Egypt.
meanings.sent5: The smell of freshly baked azyme filled the house, signaling the start of the holiday.
